column4: I had a quick question that I probably read over twice;  Is it normal for things to not execute (firefox, apps, etc) while I'm downloading/installing the distribution upgrade to 8.10 from 8.04?
if you try running firefox while it's getting updated I would expect strange things to happen
nah.. I don't think so.. just leave the poor computer alone while it updates =)
because most games are written for windows
don't expect to run the latest titles at full speed on your shiny linux computer
some stuff works using wine but usually considerably slower
that doesn't mean that there aren't games available for linux.. there are plenty.. just not quite as many as for windows
I don't think it would improve things
I think more like your wine install would stop working... but I'm just guessing
not really, no
it's a little different.. but barely noticable
try them both... see which one you like
you could also take a look at quassel.. it's brand new so it might lack some features.. but it's still nice
try "chmod a+x thefile.run", then "./thefile.run"
case sensitive? AtiDdriver isn't the same as atidriver.run
case sensitive? AtiDriver.run isn't the same as atidriver.run
lspci | grep vga ?
lspci, lsusb and lshw are the ones I know of
but the grep part is just for filtering the results
I would suggesting something like python.. or take a look at mono, the linux implementation of .net
tried Applications, accessories, Character Map ?
